alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 7:20PM MDT until May 14 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Castle Creek near Midwest could be affected later this evening into the overnight as water flows and collects in this drainage. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes/valleys. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bothwell Draw, Casper Creek, Castle Creek, Salt Creek, Horse Ranch Creek, East Teapot Creek, McKenzie Draw, Middle Fork Casper Creek, South Fork Castle Creek, Dead Horse Creek, Cloud Creek, East Fork Horse Ranch Creek, Lone Tree Creek, North Fork Casper Creek, Teapot Creek, North Fork Dead Horse Creek, Stove Gulch, Cottonwood Creek, North Cottonwood Creek, Dugout Creek and Alkali Creek. - Some locations that may experience high flows in streams include... Midwest and Edgerton.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads.
